dependencies.description: External git dependencies used for syntax checks

7bit_ascii.description:
Only allow characters from the 7bit ASCII set.
https://rules.abaplint.org/7bit_ascii

abapdoc.description:
Various checks regarding abapdoc.
Base rule checks for existence of abapdoc for public class methods and all interface methods.
https://rules.abaplint.org/abapdoc

allowed_object_naming.description:
Enforces basic name length and namespace restrictions
https://rules.abaplint.org/allowed_object_naming

allowed_object_types.description:
Restricts the set of allowed object types.
https://rules.abaplint.org/allowed_object_types

ambiguous_statement.description:
Checks for ambiguity between deleting or modifying from internal and database table
Add "TABLE" keyword or "@" for escaping SQL variables
https://rules.abaplint.org/ambiguous_statement

avoid_use.description:
Detects usage of certain statements.
https://rules.abaplint.org/avoid_use

begin_end_names.description:
Check BEGIN OF and END OF names match
https://rules.abaplint.org/begin_end_names

check_abstract.description:
Checks abstract methods and classes:
- class defined as abstract and final,
- non-abstract class contains abstract methods
https://rules.abaplint.org/check_abstract

check_comments.description:
Various checks for comment usage.
https://rules.abaplint.org/check_comments

check_ddic.description:
Checks the types of DDIC objects can be resolved, the namespace of the development/errors can be configured in "errorNamespace"
https://rules.abaplint.org/check_ddic

check_no_handler_pragma.description:
Checks NO_HANDLER pragmas that can be removed
https://rules.abaplint.org/check_no_handler_pragma

check_syntax.description:
Enables syntax check and variable resolution
https://rules.abaplint.org/check_syntax

check_text_elements.description:
Check text elements exists or matches code
https://rules.abaplint.org/check_text_elements

check_transformation_exists.description:
Checks that used XSLT transformations exist.
https://rules.abaplint.org/check_transformation_exists

class_attribute_names.description:
Allows you to enforce a pattern, such as a prefix, for class variable names.
https://rules.abaplint.org/class_attribute_names

cloud_types.description:
Checks that the package does not contain any object types unsupported in cloud ABAP.
https://rules.abaplint.org/cloud_types

colon_missing_space.description:
Checks for missing spaces after colons in chained statements.
https://rules.abaplint.org/colon_missing_space

commented_code.description:
Detects usage of commented out code.
https://rules.abaplint.org/commented_code

constructor_visibility_public.description:
Constructor must be placed in the public section, even if the class is not CREATE PUBLIC.
https://rules.abaplint.org/constructor_visibility_public

contains_tab.description:
Checks for usage of tabs (enable to enforce spaces)
https://docs.abapopenchecks.org/checks/09/
https://rules.abaplint.org/contains_tab

definitions_top.description:
Checks that definitions are placed at the beginning of methods.
https://rules.abaplint.org/definitions_top

description_empty.description:
Ensures descriptions in class metadata exist.
https://rules.abaplint.org/description_empty

double_space.description:
Checks that only a single space follows certain common statements.
https://rules.abaplint.org/double_space

empty_line_in_statement.description:
Checks that statements do not contain empty lines.
https://rules.abaplint.org/empty_line_in_statement

empty_statement.description:
Checks for empty statements (an empty statement is a single dot)
https://rules.abaplint.org/empty_statement

empty_structure.description:
Checks that the code does not contain empty blocks.
https://rules.abaplint.org/empty_structure

exit_or_check.description:
Detects usages of EXIT or CHECK statements outside of loops.
https://rules.abaplint.org/exit_or_check

exporting.description:
Detects EXPORTING statements which can be omitted.
https://rules.abaplint.org/exporting

forbidden_identifier.description:
Forbid use of specified identifiers, list of regex
https://rules.abaplint.org/forbidden_identifier

form_no_dash.description:
Checks for a Dash in form names
https://rules.abaplint.org/form_no_dash

form_tables_obsolete.description:
Checks for TABLES parameters in forms.
https://rules.abaplint.org/form_tables_obsolete

fully_type_constants.description:
Checks constants for full typing - no implicit typing allowed.
https://rules.abaplint.org/fully_type_constants

functional_writing.description:
Detects usage of call method when functional style calls can be used.
https://rules.abaplint.org/functional_writing

global_class.description:
Checks related to names of global classes. For the name pattern, see rule object_naming
https://rules.abaplint.org/global_class

if_in_if.description:
Detects nested ifs which can be refactored to a single condition using AND.
https://rules.abaplint.org/if_in_if

implement_methods.description:
Chekcs for abstract methods which need implementing.
https://rules.abaplint.org/implement_methods

in_statement_indentation.description:
Checks alignment within block statement declarations which span multiple lines, such as multiple conditions in IF statements.
Example:
IF 1 = 1 AND
  2 = 2.
https://rules.abaplint.org/in_statement_indentation

inline_data_old_versions.description:
Checks for inline data declarations in older releases.
https://rules.abaplint.org/inline_data_old_versions

keep_single_parameter_on_one_line.description:
Keep single parameter calls on one line
https://github.com/SAP/styleguides/blob/master/clean-abap/CleanABAP.md#keep-single-parameter-calls-on-one-line
https://rules.abaplint.org/keep_single_parameter_on_one_line

keyword_case.description:
Checks that keywords have the same case. Non-keywords must be lower case.
https://rules.abaplint.org/keyword_case

line_length.description:
Detects lines exceeding the provided maximum length.
https://rules.abaplint.org/line_length

line_only_punc.description:
Detects lines containing only punctuation.
https://rules.abaplint.org/line_only_punc

local_class_naming.description:
Allows you to enforce a pattern, such as a prefix, for local class names.
https://rules.abaplint.org/local_class_naming

local_testclass_location.description:
Checks that local test classes are placed in the test include.
https://rules.abaplint.org/local_testclass_location

local_variable_names.description:
Allows you to enforce a pattern, such as a prefix, for local variables, constants and field symbols.
https://rules.abaplint.org/local_variable_names

max_one_statement.description:
Checks that each line contains only a single statement.
https://rules.abaplint.org/max_one_statement

message_exists.description:
In message statements, check that the message class + id exist
https://rules.abaplint.org/message_exists

method_length.description:
Checks relating to method length.
https://rules.abaplint.org/method_length

method_parameter_names.description:
Allows you to enforce a pattern, such as a prefix, for method parameter names
https://rules.abaplint.org/method_parameter_names

mix_returning.description:
Checks that methods don't have a mixture of returning and exporting/changing parameters
https://rules.abaplint.org/mix_returning

msag_consistency.description:
Checks the validity of messages in message classes
https://rules.abaplint.org/msag_consistency

nesting.description:
Checks for methods exceeding a maximum nesting depth
https://github.com/SAP/styleguides/blob/master/clean-abap/CleanABAP.md#keep-the-nesting-depth-low
https://docs.abapopenchecks.org/checks/74/
https://rules.abaplint.org/nesting

newline_between_methods.description:
Checks for newlines between method implementations.
https://rules.abaplint.org/newline_between_methods

no_public_attributes.description:
Checks that classes and interfaces don't contain any public attributes.
Exceptions are excluded from this rule.
https://rules.abaplint.org/no_public_attributes

object_naming.description:
Allows you to enforce a pattern, such as a prefix, for object names
https://rules.abaplint.org/object_naming

obsolete_statement.description:
Checks for usages of certain obsolete statements
https://rules.abaplint.org/obsolete_statement

parser_error.description:
Checks for syntax unrecognized by abaplint
https://rules.abaplint.org/parser_error

prefix_is_current_class.description:
Reports errors if the current class references itself with "current_class=>"
https://github.com/SAP/styleguides/blob/master/clean-abap/CleanABAP.md#omit-the-self-reference-me-when-calling-an-instance-method
https://rules.abaplint.org/prefix_is_current_class

release_idoc.description:
Checks idoc types and segments are set to status released
https://rules.abaplint.org/release_idoc

remove_descriptions.description:
Ensures you have no descriptions in metadata of methods, parameters, etc. For class descriptions, see rule description_empty.
https://rules.abaplint.org/remove_descriptions

rfc_error_handling.description:
Checks that exceptions 'system_failure' and 'communication_failure' are handled in RFC calls
https://help.sap.com/doc/abapdocu_750_index_htm/7.50/en-US/abenrfc_exception.htm
https://rules.abaplint.org/rfc_error_handling

selection_screen_naming.description:
Allows you to enforce a pattern, such as a prefix, for selection-screen variable names.
https://rules.abaplint.org/selection_screen_naming

sequential_blank.description:
Checks that code does not contain more than the configured number of blank lines in a row.
https://rules.abaplint.org/sequential_blank

short_case.description:
Checks for CASE statements which have fewer than the specified number of branches
https://rules.abaplint.org/short_case

sicf_consistency.description:
Checks the validity of ICF services
https://rules.abaplint.org/sicf_consistency

space_before_colon.description:
Checks that there are no spaces in front of colons in chained statements.
https://docs.abapopenchecks.org/checks/80/
https://rules.abaplint.org/space_before_colon

space_before_dot.description:
Checks for extra spaces before dots at the ends of statements .
https://rules.abaplint.org/space_before_dot

start_at_tab.description:
Checks that statements start at tabstops.
https://rules.abaplint.org/start_at_tab

superclass_final.description:
Checks that classes which are inherited from are not declared as FINAL.
https://rules.abaplint.org/superclass_final

tabl_enhancement_category.description:
Checks that tables do not have the enhancement category 'not classified'
https://rules.abaplint.org/tabl_enhancement_category

try_without_catch.description:
Checks for TRY blocks without a CATCH block
https://rules.abaplint.org/try_without_catch

type_begin_single_include.description:
Finds TYPE BEGIN with just one INCLUDE TYPE
https://rules.abaplint.org/type_begin_single_include

types_naming.description:
Allows you to enforce a pattern for TYPES definitions
https://rules.abaplint.org/types_naming

unknown_types.description:
Enables check for unknown types, respects errorNamespace
https://rules.abaplint.org/unknown_types

use_new.description:
Checks for deprecated CREATE OBJECT statements.
https://rules.abaplint.org/use_new

when_others_last.description:
Checks that WHEN OTHERS is placed the last within a CASE statement.
https://rules.abaplint.org/when_others_last

whitespace_end.description:
Checks for redundant whitespace at the end of each line.
https://rules.abaplint.org/whitespace_end

xml_consistency.description:
Checks the consistency of main XML files, eg. naming
https://rules.abaplint.org/xml_consistency

folder.description: Name of local folder with dependencies

useApackDependencies.description: Clone and parse dependencies specified in .apack-manifest.xml if it is present

NewlineBetweenMethodsConf.description: Checks for newlines between method implementations.

logic.description:
Exact: the exact number of required newlines between methods is defined by "newlineAmount"

Less: the required number of newlines has to be less than "newlineAmount"
